data.title: Erie County Community Foundation grants application open
data.meta_description: The 2024 Erie County Community Foundation grants application portal is officially open, according to a news release.Round 2 grant applications are due by 11:59 p.m. Aug. 1, the release said.The application can be found at www.eriefoundation.org/community-grants along with a full description of grant priorities.Erie County Community Foundation encourages proposals for projects that collaborate among Erie […]
data.text:
The 2024 Erie County Community Foundation grants application portal is officially open, according to a news release.

Round 2 grant applications are due by 11:59 p.m. Aug. 1, the release said.

The application can be found at www.eriefoundation.org/community-grants along with a full description of grant priorities.

Erie County Community Foundation encourages proposals for projects that collaborate among Erie County organizations, build organizational capacity, leverage additional resources, demonstrate sustainability and address community needs, according to the release.

Applying organizations must be determined to be tax-exempt nonprofits by the IRS under section 501(c)3.

The minimum grant award is $1,000, with a typical range of $1,000 to $20,000, according to the release.

Generally, each grant is awarded for one year only.

Grant projects must serve Erie County residents.

In Round 1 2024, the Erie County Community Foundation awarded grant dollars totaling more than $228,000 to 27 organizations.

Organizations awarded in Round 1

• Animal House Sober Club

• Back to the Wild Inc.

• Bellevue Society for the Arts

• Bowling Green State University FBO McBride Arboretum

• Boys & Girls Clubs of Northeast Ohio

• Erie County CASA Program

• Erie County Economic Development Corp.

• Erie Metro Live Steamers

• Erie Metropolitan Housing Authority

• Erie Soil and Water Conservation District

• Father’s Heart Ministry

• Firelands Symphony Orchestra

• First Christian Church FBO Obediah’s Hope: An Equine Ministry

• Huron Public Library

• Kelley’s Island Local School District

• Leadership Ohio

• Make-A-Wish Foundation of Ohio, Kentucky, and Indiana

• Nehemiah Partners of Sandusky

• North Point Educational Service Center

• OHgo

• OhioGuidestone

• Perkins Local Schools

• Perkins Township

• Sandusky Area Maritime Association

• Sandusky City Schools

• Vermilion Schools Athletic Boosters Inc.

• Western Reserve Land Conservancy

Grant cycles occur twice each year, with applications due Feb. 1 and Aug. 1, according to the release.

Erie County Community Foundation is a nonprofit dedicated to building a thriving and vibrant Erie County by addressing community needs, providing leadership and cultivating resources for a lasting impact, according to the release.

The organization’s primary purpose is to provide a means for people to make permanent gifts of assets to enhance the quality of life in Erie County and Sandusky, Ohio, today, tomorrow and forever, the release said.
